i have thought about this problem,
i guess the right attitude:
1. recognizing the fact that HK is being colonized by mainland Chinese
2. recognizing that HK people are special and are able to fight for a place in the international arena among the big power politics
In the last two big wars, HK was still a fishing village, imagine you were in 194x. HK is totally different right now and foreign people are starting to recognising the special identity and unity of the HK people, esp. from this movement. What we need to position ourselves is something like Switzerland and Israel, trying to breakthrough the impossible and trying to be ourselves, establish our place.

Give you an example, Swiss people speak French/German/English, some are even descendants of like Spanish, but they still maintain a territory of their own. Do you notice that German vs. French were century long enemies? Will they be ashamed of themselves just because French was defeated by German but German was defeated by the English-speaking people? The fact that there were some emotions that mattered decades ago does not mean it has to continue for the time being.

3. if you love Chinese culture, you should hate the current communist party which means you should wish a defeat on the part of 'People's Republic of China', because PRC = CCP. Recognise that a defeat of China is only a defeat of CCP.
